result.execSummary:
The defendant John Matthew Ludtke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Matthew Ludtke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Matthew Ludtke was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: costs assessed are paid in full

30 days in Marquette County Jail with huber. Consecutive to any other sentence. Report on or before November 16, 2015 by 7:00 P.M. clean & sober.
May serve in Dodge County Jail.
Good time.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence he is currently serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Matthew Ludtke in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided; today there is resolution with an argued sentence.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that he is in agreement however, he is just disputing the jail time.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant waives their right to an attorney and would like to proceed.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 30 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber; consecutive to any other sentence
  Report on or before November 16, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May serve in Dodge County Jail
Good Time
Court Costs - $243.00
DNA Surcharge only - $200.00
Credit = 2 days
bond to be applied
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

Pre-trial conference at 09-08-2015 09:30 am.
Return date at 10-08-2015 03:30 pm.

Defendant John Matthew Ludtke in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant regarding the criminal complaint  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  
  Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return and pre-trial
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 03:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
